number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 22, 2014
												If you are looking to buy this game to relive the glory of stronghold 1 or 2 think again.  This game is a step waaay back from the first two.  Although the graphics were much improved everthing else is absolutely crap.  It was full of bugs some of which killed what very little enjoyment i got from playing it.  The pathfinding script is so flawed that your army has trouble negotiating simple terrain.  The AI is a joke.  There is no co op options in the multi player set up.  The building options are clunky  and make no sence.  The maps are all small,  even the so called large ones.  This version make building any kind of keep difficult to the point of frustration because the maps are so small.  The zoom in and out optios are so limited that building become very difficult.  Firefly really shot themselves in the foot on this one.  They made promises about the game mechanics and multiplayer options and never kept them stating they never intended to include them, but the manual clearly states that those options are there.  In fact the Firefly forums for this game are all complaints.  The quit supporting this game and flat out refused to do any more work to fix the game other than making it stable, which it wasn't at release.  considering that the Stronghold series is what put these guys on the map this latest release will likely put them in the poorhouse if not out of business.  I flat out refuse to buy anymore Firefly products because of their attitude toward a broken unfinished game.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2012
												Like Stronghold 2, the mass of patches as of March2012 have fixed 99% of the issues and added additional content. However, this game still feels a bit incomplete on the gameplay side and certainly feels lesser to that of Stronghold Crusader. The graphics are pretty decent, but I would have prefered more focus on gameplay. After all the patches, I'd give this more of a 60/100 as there's still more work to go. Diehard fans will still enjoy this and it's quite difficult too! Not like the strategy in the classic games with so much more luck involved in many more random events.  60/100 is a fair score that cannot increase until the content increases.  They shoulda used the same brilliant story telling method of Stronghold instead of the confusing sketch slideshows and "thrown into midst of battle" military campaign levels.  With that the meta could go up!

content:
Posted: December 29, 2013
												I very much regret buying this game. I loved stronghold 2 and the rest of the Stronghold games. But this one was bad.... The online is unplayable (if anyone even plays it) and theres no skirmish mode (You vs. AI) At ALL! I love playing vs the AI on Stronghold 2. Its pretty difficult and fun to just try to build the ultimate castle and army. But theres no mode for this. Id love if there was a custom game mode creator where you could add AIs to verse on a map of your choosing and the settings of your choosing. But there is not. Luckily I got the game on sale. So i didnt get ENTIRELY screwed over. The campaign is okay. But I know most people like to have a competitive experience wheter it be with others online or against an AI. I for one would not recommend you buy this game if you like Stronghold 2 and are thinking this is level up and an upgrade from it. Most things are exactly the same. The only difference is the graphics (which are really great actually). All in all I can exaggerate enough how dissapointed I am.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Stronghold and Stronghold Crusader were fantastic games. I loved them and spent hours of my life playing them - this game is completely different. Stronghold 3 started off badly with a buggy launch, missing features, and an awkard learning curve. Even after several patches it still isn't enjoyable to play.Micro-management is dull and repetitive, combat is boring to watch and your castles can look "okay" at best. The medieval charm of the original games do not shine through in this one, unfortunately. I'd recommend skipping this purchase and getting one of the original games instead, or waiting in anticipation that Firefly Studios don't make a mess of Stronghold Crusader 2 - we can always hope!3/10

content:
Posted: October 28, 2014
												This game is a joke.I'm a big fan of the Stronghold Series but I can not find any single positive aspect in the third part.The new building system is kind of annoying, you can't even set straight walls so there is no way to build a symetric castle.The spots where the walls stick to another are buggy as well.Even the titlescreen looks horrible and contains nothing but a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ yellow background and a guy who is looking at you like a crazy old♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥It is just a bad Stronghold 2 with less features like the Tortureguild, the punishments, the treasury and so on...Tannery is also not included anymore , so to recruit some Crossbowmen you just have to produce Crossbows - that's it.This is taking so much of the well done complexity of Stronghold 2 wich led the player to do more thoughtful actions.Now it is just a clumsy 'cut some wood here, produce this and that there' until i got a little army walking towards to the ugly enemy castle.The campaign is boring and the ''cutscenes'' are loveless images of black and white figures talking about war and revenge.The gameplay itself is uncomfortable, you feel that the engine is not good at all after playing for a few seconds.After all this stuff they also left out the skirmish mode wich have ever been the heart and soul of Stronghold.I am totally disappointed and would recommend to everybody who is thinking about buying this to do not.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2015
												It's not entirely bad game. It's just, it does not quite feels the same as the good old Stronghold 1.I can't exactly pinpoint what is wrong with this game, but it feels more dull and awkward, comparing to the older predesessor of Stonghold. It could be the awkward animations or maybe the lack of zoom or these weird green squares around all of your buildings... Or the complete lack of personality in your population, they become less of a people under your command and more of just... Units you can use as you please. Or maybe it's awkward phisics with projectiles and such. Or the lack of skirmish mode. I dunno, guys. It could be the sum of all of it together, but...I feel like it lost it's spirit since the second part of the series and it never got to be even close to what the first part felt like. And I will say once again... The game is not bad. It's just doesn't feel like that good old game that I used to spend days playing and enjoying every single moment of it.I will not make a negative review of this game, as it is not entirelly bad. It's just... Feels incomplete and more of a game than a whole living a breathing universe as the first part used to be. But I do not recommend you to buy it eighter. It's not worth your time and money.4/10.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												The very first Sim type game I ever played was the Original Stronghold, and from there I was mesmerized. Then Stronghold 2 came out and for all of its ♥♥♥♥♥♥ storyline, It had a great interactive system. Following the line of games in the Stronghold line there were hits and misses aplenty but none of them were truly God Awful.Until Now. Ladies and Gentlemen I give you, The biggest pile of crap on Steam. The Game that if anyone ever payed for, no matter how small the price, should receive a full return of their payment a written letter of apology from Gabe, and everyone at Firefly studios.You took the orignial game and storyline and gave it a slight ENB setting change. Then you took the worst mechanics from other games, put them in, and left out all of the great mechanics. Why would you cut out the content that made the other games acceptable as continuations to the story?  So that you could fix nothing about the graphical errors or the faulty mechanics of the orignial without having to patch in new mechanics or graphics from the later installments.If The original game had a performance level of 5. Its sequel had a level 8.0 Crusaders 1 and 2  were respectively 8.0 and 7.5 The King Arthur varient was probably a 6.5 but because of novelty became a 7.5And This Game is a 3. STronghold Online is a 2. Everything about this game offends. The cutscenes, the audio, the lack of detail from ANY other game. Oh you can be greeted by your peasants and see their names when you click on them? Not in this game. You can earn honor and influence to purchase estates and create traderoutes between other villages? Not in this game. You can host Balls and Feasts that are measured through the livelyhood of your village?  Well here, were back to basics with Food storages, and Weapons storages. Anything else is just fluff in the medeival era. WHo needs Jousting tourneys or Medeival torture for criminals, who needs Renn fairs to make the villages happy or Mercenary camps to implore new types of troops from across the seas in the holy land, WHO NEEDS A STRONGHOLD GAME IN 2010 WHEN WE HAVE THIS GARBAGE.Sorry Firefly. I no longer want to own any of your products. You're all scum.

content:
Posted: April 19, 2014
												Stronghold 3 is a complete disappointment. The game is devoid of the charm of its predecessors and goes so far as to be a bad game. The battles are a big part of the game but, the AI is nonexistent and moving your army around is an immense struggle making the even a simple skirmish a massive pain. This could be forgiven if the economic gameplay wasn’t entirely broken, most buildings produce too slowly to keep up with a steadily growing demand, you'll find yourself with frequent food shortages despite having more than enough farms. Even the castle building, a cornerstone of the series is a glitchy and counterproductive mess.I strongly recommend you do not waste your time and money on this game.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												It's sad as I was really looking forward to this game, but it's just not fun to play, and it was ruined simply due to a few major factors that killed the game for me (note that I only play RTSs in singleplayer).The first problem that is it SHOULD have built upon Stronghold 2, which was an excellent game that was killed by a handful of crippling flaws (random crippling gong/rat disasters, resources were too demanding for basic units, and bad mission/campaign structures and progression. Instead this time they overcautiously regressed to Stronghold 1, but kept a lot of SH2 flaws and included a bunch of new ones.The engine is actually less advanced than its predecessor in many ways that hurts the gameplay. Firstly, it is very buggy: dying enemies spawn giant triangles that block the screen, and in one mission my keep was invisible. The interface is horrible- unlike the previous games that allowed very simple, versatile and accurate structure placement, this version seems incomplete- placing structures is clumsy, fiddly and difficult, walls are much harder to place OR connect (especially to structures that are supposed to back onto them like the Barracks), and the AI is awful, where the player often loses control for extended periods by sending units onto battlements. Combat is also a pain to organizeThe multi-storey defenses are GONE with plain Strong-hold 1 structures returning (a pity). Yet the gameplay elements that turned Stronghold 2 from excellent to downright bad ARE STILL HERE. Random unpreventable disasters are back (which at least are more managable and less crippling than last time- except for the bears that spawn inside my castle and wipe out my farms). The awful campaign/mission structure in the previous game is back, with annoying and frustrating missions like escorting VERY slow units around, with the first proper defensive mission not occurring until the FOURTH LEVEL (the first mission archers are available too- before then you get your peasants to charge the enemy). Also, while the goofy characters and dialogue from Stronghold 2 are gone, there is simply no characters or dialogue at all- you get a few still-frame comics with a narrated monologue voiceover (by the Wolf and the two heroes only) at the start and end of each mission, and that's it.  One very good positive over the last game however is that lower units like archers no longer require Honour (which was a good idea- but should have only applied to top-level units to make them harder to spam).Overall it's a huge pity, as Firefly had a lot to work with by their previous games, and could have very easily made an excellent game. Instead it feels rushed and incomplete, with far less sophistication than the previous game, and worse, little evidence that the team did much engine testing or gameplay testing before shipping it out. I do genuinely hope they give it another shot, because they DO have the capability to make their next game amazing.

content:
Posted: November 6, 2015
												I enjoyed the previous versions of Stronghold to some extend. Clearly version 2 is the best. Version 3 is by far the worst. Sloppy programming, Units stuck, Dull landscape, Impossible to get stance of soldiers to anything. Insane bias towards computer AI. Expect to have to defend impossible positions and single archers decimating your ranks from 20% greater distance than you can shoot. Expect battles in which even at puny level the amount of soldiers you get to defend or attack is half that what the computer opponent gets. Expect not to be able to rotate the battle field or unseen enemies lurking in trees and no way to kill them. Expect enemies to field entire armies in the time you barely can get 10 villagers to spawn. Sad stuff really. Was a good game.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2014
												I had been waiting for the game to come out for about a year, thinking that it was like stronghold crusader and 2. The moment i booted up, my heart sank. It is basically stronghold 2, but buggier and not having anything that even resembles any sort of skirmish. Skirmish had been the best part of all of the older strongholds, and was what i was looking forward to the most, but it is not there. It is also buggy as ♥♥♥♥, with units getting stuck in walls and archers sometimes hugging the enemy while attacking them. I would not recommend this game due to that, and i hope that Stronghold 4 fixes all of that, or else i will not get it. I cant believe that firefly would release it like this. If you want stronghold games, I would definetely go for crusader or 2. Those games were made in 2001 and 2005, and they are much more enjoyable that this.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												Open gameClick TutorialGame CrashsesClick Military CampaignGame CrashsesClick Economic Campaign Game Crashes10/10 best gameIn all seriousness though; I eventually got one of the custom maps to work, and had quite a bit of fun assaulting the community made castle. Unfortunatly it did not last long as the force I was given was very over powered. This game is very pretty and a lot of detail was put into it. I liked how when I box selected units they would do battle cries and chants depending on the number of men I selected. It is just a shame that this game just refuses to play. I could easily have 100+ hours on this game if it would just run. If the game was fixed I would recomend this, even if the devs expressed how they were possibly working on fixing this I would still recomend this. Sadly the devs just pushed the game out and left it to rot. This game had so much potential and hype it saddens me that this will be most likely the last traditional Stronghold game. At least there is Crusaders 2.

												Stronghold 3 is not a horrible sequel to Stronghold 2 however it does have a few flaws such as the lack of King maker or any other A.I game mode. Multilayer is dead and a few bugs exist. The recent patches seem to fix most of the problem and the campaign is good. Honestly the graphics are average (much better than Stronghold 2) however it could have been better. Voice acting sounded cheap but acceptable. Stronghold 3 is an above average rts but defiantly not the amazing squeal everyone expected. Buy it if your a fan of the series and if it is on sale, otherwise it's not worth it.

content:
Posted: April 27, 2014
												This game had promis like the past games, but not having an AI for a skirmish mode or Kingsmaker mode; made this game fall flat on its stupid face. 80% of the enjoyment I get from ANY RTS is skermish modes and I know most ppl feel the same, probably not all but most. When most of your player base get that kind of enjoyment out of a game, you would think the makers would have half a brain to add it. I suppose they spent there allowance on getting used to the new 3D style RTS and  it just took too much money, I cannot say for sure but I got this on pakage sale cuz im not a sucker like a lot of the ppl who paid full price. NEVER impusle buy even if ads make a game look good; wait for proper review and THEN decide if its worth your hard earned money. If companys add all this PRE-order stuff that makes you REALLY want the added stuff then the game is probably crap or ripoff OR not done, don't fall for it guys and gals.

number of helpful: 15 of 32 people (47%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												This game is Great! Here's why. User created games! That is what makes this game awesome! Individual quests that you can get off the website or a search. You will have to put the file from the internet into a specific game folder, the web will tell you how, its not hard. New goals to be reached, taking over multiple castles, and some games have a feature that allows you to send armies of choosable size to attack you, and to change other things. Some games are dumb. Some are epic. Find em, download em, and enjoy.  This game is still a worthy play. The "bugs" everyone are talking about are the semi-cheats that were removed from previous games, (like building walls and buildings on mountains and unstable ground, and layering castle walls.) The AI has always been very dumb in the stronghold series, so why complain now? Do you want these soldiers to all run their own highly organized black op mission?! Give the cold, wet, untrianed, underaged, malnourished, poorly clothed, diseased, dirty, smelly, soldiers of the dark ages a break would you!  I am bummed tha some of the buildings are gone from stronghold 2, but looking at reviews of that game, these were buildings that had niches to how they worked, and could be a pain. Like catching criminals, and gong farming. I like this game. I hope that more user games get made. After seeing all the nasty reviews there probably won't be another Stronghold.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2013
												Stronghold 3...... *sigh*Stronghold and Stronghold Crusader were this companies greatest entries into the "Stronghold" Series... its been a downhill slide ever since then.Stronghold 3 has ok music, and a passable storyline (that we've all heard before...) but thats not its biggest flaws.BUGS, GLITCHES, and FREEZES however are.  This game feels rushed and unpolished, and with zero response from the dev's about updates or patches, you have to assume there will be none.Several missions have you forced with only a few units to face an entire army of invaders.. you might think there are several ways to win at this mission... you would be completly wrong.. you must complete the mission the EXACT way the developers planned for you to, or you will be totally decimated.. thus taking away the fun of trying your own thing.the worst offender of this is a Castle seige mission where you are given 2 catapults, 1 ram, 15 pikemen, 20 archers, and a couple of archer sheild things... you have to breach a 2 stage wall, and the keep that are totally lined with archers, and about 50 macemen and roughly the same number of pikemen around the keep.   if you dont move your units exactly to required positions (which are totally obvious) you lose... period. (oh look a convenient hill overlooking their castle and its undefended, Wow what luck *eyeroll*)I own Stronghold, S:Crusaders, S:Gold, S:2, and now S:3  and 3 is by far... the worst of them all.  by a huge margin... i wont be buying S:4 or any other stronghold game ever again because of this.  Ive lost faith in the brand and the company now.Just do yourself a favor... buy Stronghold Gold, and forget the rest even exist.1/10 (because of bugs and poor design)

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												I fully recommend this game, the graphics are amazing, the 360 rotation of buildings adds realism and is quite cool, the random events are mostly exiting and adds uniqueness to this game, i enjoy games like this and i like how there is a 'free build mode' so the kingdom can be created easily and quickly and the fun won't be lost while playing.There are a range of structures and in this game, your status counts; e.g Honor is needed to recruit knights on the other hand the battles are cool with full animation in the battles so the game still feels smooth, i love how if you zoom in closer to the town, you hear conversations of the villagers and the atmosphere of the town feels right, but when you zoom out that sound mutes and a slight wind can be heared creating a full effect of the map, the movement of the villagers and units is smooth and looks really good, the animation of the villagers matches what role they play in the town, for example a farmer would collect his crops and carry them in to his house.i would definetly recommend this game to all.

												A buggy, grinding, lamentable mess, that only succeeds in capturing the worst of the RTS genre, and hobbles the very thing you are doubtlessly looking at this game for: castle building. Horrible mechanics, restrictive placement, and a horrible means to place your soldiers ... or lack of means, I should say ... all make this an avoidable title. 												when i first played stronghold crusader i thought GOD himself had come down and blessed me with such a game with pretty much anything you could ask from a strategy game, i guess there could be some tweaking here and there with the game modes and some more map types , but apart from that its every strategy gamers heaven.so i when i heard about stronghold 3 gold soon to be realeased i had to go and change my underwear i couldent wait to get it , but now ive waited 3 and a half hour for it to download just twiddeling my thumbs to find out that when i launched it it dosent even have a PvIA or skirmish mode i almost cried that was on of the best things about stronghold 2 with the new colonies buildings and being able to take over just small villiages to help your onslaught of the enemy, but now stronhold 3 just consists of more campains and online PvP but dont get me wrong thats all good apart from having to have a graphics card the size of a fully grown male mammoth to actually be able to play a game without it taking 3 years as it lags like mad on a laptop.still i would recommend it to strategy gamers as it hold a different prospective to war with the wide range of unit and bulding to help you get through the day, just remeber to read other reviews and features before buying it.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 27, 2013
												Amazing how Firefly can present an extremely tired genre in a manner that feels just as fresh and exciting as Westwood and Blizzard's efforts back in the 90's when RTS first went viral. They've taken Settlers and removed all of the dull and unnecessary ramblings and tangents streamliing a more intense and eventful experience.If only Firefly's marketing efforts were as strong as their craftsmanship as SH3 opens to reveal a dead sign-on to their leaderboards and world-mapped depiction of your labours.Gone the way of ad-supported, HTML5, Facebook fodder they did. No use keeping online interaction in SH3 competing against thier latest endeavors.Multiplayer is still there but without the bells and whistles you woud be lucky to find one server after waiting a good half hour so co-dependents need not apply.Also recommended is Firefly's "Space Colony" which can be found on GOG.comPrice Recommended: $15

content:
Posted: January 29, 2014
												This game does not deserve the bad rep it has received, there I said it. Yes the game was buggy as hell on release, but the point is they fixed it, the game runs really smoothly now, the graphics is pretty decent, the new features are awesome, especially the random events and weather changes, the story is not bad at all and I enjoyed the fact that you can place and rotate buildings a little bit more freely then in the previous games, the smallish mapsizes are a downside but not a big one.Seriously try the game, and do so with an open mind and without listening to all the reviews out there, judge for yourself and you may find a nice little gem in this game, I rate it 7.5/10

content:

												Atmospheric, challenging and fun - I can't understand why there are so many negative reviews! OK, maybe it was full of bugs when it was first released, but it's not now, so get over it! Sometimes a unit does still get stuck in a wall but it doesn't happen often, and that just adds to the difficulty.I've really enjoyed playing all of the missions and especially the historical sieges. In my view the graphics are far better than in the predecessors, and the gameplay is at least as good as the original, and much better than Stronghold 2.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												I refused to write a review in order to give firefly a chance to fix the game, after so many patches  (last patch in 2011) I decided to review the game, cause I lost hope in this game, the developers cant fix much really, instead they keep adding useless stuff like new maps & modes for multiplayer (multiplayer itself is still not working well), siege maps (boring to hell)... After you finish the military and economic campaigns there are no much to do, so you will go for free build, where you will build one time and set and invasion (then you wont play it again for sure) so after that you will jump into multiplayer, you will struggle and waste time in order to start the game, and if you succeed you will lag and maybe crash, thats it the game itself has a great potential but it seems a lot of things are broken and will be hard to fix. Stronghold series is unique and I love it, but SH3 is just so buggy with missing features that were avalable in previous game (skirmish for example)... This will be thier last game for sure, untill some developers will come and make us a nice castle RTS/ Sim..

number of helpful: 6 of 16 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												I’m giving a “thumbs up” to SH3 because, despite its flaws, it retains the spirit of its predecessors and I actually had fun playing it.It helps that you can pick it up cheap and they’ve patched it so I personally didn’t experience any major crashes or bugs. Ok, the odd unit did get stuck in a wall but that never ruined the fun.I found the overall gameplay fine and had no problems with the UI or the economy or the building.  Having played all the older ones this one seems largely similar, which also includes the bad bits, and certainly does things no better. My biggest gripe, that I have to mention, would be the lack of a skirmish mode.  This really limits the amount of time I’ve played it and for a castle building game the story line had too few opportunities to build a skirmish-mode-like castle.So as a fan of the series, yes this incarnation was disappointing and limited, but I’d still recommend it when it appears in the sale, just to get a fix of castle building.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21
												Ok, here goes, So I have played and loved all the Stronghold games since day 1, so I write this review a bit biased.I love the conept of building a fortress to defend while maintaining an economy.If you find this on sale it's worth it for the sheer experience of another Stronghold game.However, be warned it's challenging, several times I had to restart missions because of a giant band of enemies appearing out of nowhere.  Each mission seems to have a "trick" to solving it. If a new troop is introduced you can bet it's used to win that scenario.  So my recommendation is based solely on loving the entire franchise really not this one specific game.If you haven't played any of the previous games don't start with this one.

Posted: June 5, 2014
												So I made a review a while back. I completely got rid of it and I am just going to get everything out.This game made me cry.I've been a huge fan of the series and well... It's like someone took a huge, smelly dump all over the game, but wiped it off (not well) and said "Here you go!" PROS: + Beautiful graphics and animations+ Free build has awesome settings to customize weather and attacks from enemies+ Campaigns are awesome! +Torturing devices are really cool CONS: - The buildings are boring- The combat is just awful- Free build maps are limited and boring- A BUILDING LIMIT. yeah, YOU HAVE A LIMIT ON HOW MANY BUILDINGS YOU BUILD. I could say more but I want this to be quick. it seems like there is a different developer for every Stronghold game. The first one was awesome. Stronghold 2 was amazing and now three just sucks.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												I would like to say that I wholeheartedly recommend this game, however I can merely say I can recommend this game conditionally. These conditions are that you are a Stronghold fan, and that you have a friend who is also a Stronghold fan who you can struggle through the missions together with.In this way there will be dark times ahead, but also cheery times.  From the Bees dying to yelling out "NOT THE LOGS" while assaulting a castle as well as attemting to move your units which are stuck inside the environment or buildings.  However there are also moments of hilarity and joy when you finally capture that accursed castle, The Sultana I'm looking at you, or perhaps just a sense of relief that you have finally finished the mission you have been stuck on for far too long.  If I had been playing through this game alone I would have uninstalled this game during Mission 8 and never looked at sultanas the same way again, however, as I knew my friend was going through this suffering with me, we both persevered and triumphed. Always remember, however bad you are, Scarab is still worse.So in conclusion, if you and a friend like Stronghold then I recommend both getting the game, otherwise I would probably stay away from it.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2014
												How is it they can copy everything from the origonal and still produce a inferior product. This game is awfull, it feels like a alpha. Units become permanently stuck on nothing, even more so when they come into contact with anything. Multyplayer has a forced 150 unit cap. The maps the game comes with limits you to 4 players. There is no AI in multiplayer, no coop play. Your units will engage randomly sometimes not at all allowing themselves to be cut down. units can infinitely stack on a point and if that point is on a wall it will take 5 minutes for 60 men to dispurse themselves evenly from that point. walls have 3 break animations. Campaign levels are terrible, AI wont even target your not wall related buildings. Terribly optimized barely runs the maximum of 600 units on screen. Placing buildings is slow and cumbersome and laggy for reasons beyond my understanding. and all this is just the tip of the iceburg. It does a portion of what stronghold one did and carries that portion out with the grace of a beached sea cucumber in a flock of seagulls. Avoid this buy.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 26, 2014
												Mac (IOX)I wanted to like this game, I really did. As a avid stronghold fan I was looking forward to it. I had expected something like stronghold two's castel system and stronghold crusaders level of combat difficulty. I got a watered down buggy unfinished product. I'm not sure if they even play tested this thing. One simple expample of its shortcoming is the compleat removal of any type of Player VS AI deathmatch game type, so all those stratagies that ou thought you may like but didnt want to try against human opponents? yea too bad. They also cut out custom senerios as it was called in crusader or user maps as it was called in two, entierly. This used to be one of my favorit parts of these games, being able to just go at it in compleatly customaisable enviorments. Well I guess that was jsut too much for this game.Some of the smaller yet equally annoying things are the loss of the gong and rat mechanics, this is supposed to be compisated for by a large increase of the random events however I ahve no control over wether or not rats eat half my food now, instead of before where I was held somewhat accontable. Additionaly we lost the whole crime mechanic from two, so now if you ahve criminals you had best not punish them or else you will take a hit to the painfully fickel popularity meter.They also cut out much of the difficulty I as able to beat the war and ecconomic campains without ever having to redo a level.... on the hardest difficulty. Firstly since when do we have difficultys in a Stronghold game? one of the best things was that ti forced you to put your best food forward and guided you throught the process of knowing squat about how to run a castel to being albe to take on 4 wolfs at a time (wolf the lord not the animal) secondly while I am what I would call a compitant player, I should not have been able to get through two of the three campains with no deaths on my first runthrough.Overall buggy and far to easy, 4/10.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2014
												I'm giving it a thumbs up not because it's a great game, because it's not. People have posted it's not a stronghold game, it is, just not a very good one. If your a die hard stronghold fan, thank you should explore it at least.The game felt like it wanted to be Stronghold two, where you develop your castle into more of a town, but they left out all the decorations. More so, unlike the other Stronghold's, there isn't one stage where you start from scratch and build how you want to build. Don't expect to build an epic army just to meet another epic army in the middle of the battle field and try to outwitt the AI all the while having another army building. Most of the game is simply surving.  Your always on the clock with a limited amount of days before the task is met or you made it through the attacks. What I didn't like was the limited amount of usage of the higher end units like swordsmen and knights, even crossbow men. Most of the game you use peasents as cannon fodder to protect your spear men. Though they added the ability for the spearmen to do a good amount of damange to soliders by throwing their spears, they are still the weak spearmen we all know.They did add a new type of soilder, the Ranger but since you only get to use the Ranger unit twice I never got the chance to explore the unit. If you look back to Crusaders and even stronghold legends, they have less units. No fighting monks and no mercs like the slaves that can burn down buildings or the archers on horse back. In fact there really is no use for the "well".The sieges are way to hard. You litterly have a handful of men and not enough seige weapons. It almost feel's like a puzzle and a touch of stealth when your taking down a castle. The one interesting aspect of the game I did like was the honor system. You buy statues and have varrious special buildings that allow you to throw a party which gives you honor which is needed to use higher end units like knights, swordsmen, macemen, but oddly enough not pikemen. For Multiplayer this is a great effect, it makes it so you just can attack right away like in so many other RTS games. By the time you can build a half way decent army, your going to have to go against the other players castle...But oops, if your lucky enough to find someone online playing, it's buggy once you both get building. I did like the fact that taxes actually were worth rasing and mining for materials paid a lot less which made it a must to have to build your own weapons. Unlike the other strongholds you do build weapons faster.The graphics are better, but not really haven't made leaps and bounds since the orginal. The stronghold series has never been about the graphics. I rather have had the game graphics dumb downed when the game first game out. It's pretty safe to say Firefly is finished with this game despite the few bugs it has. The only good thing that came out of this stronghold was the honor system, which is actually bearly used. Perhaps the only saving grace for stronghold 3 will be if the makers do a crusaders verison of the game.

												Stronghold 3 Gold is a game I want to enjoy but simply cannot. The prospect of building up my own castle and its economy in order prepare for war is an exciting proposition yet the unfinished and buggy nature of the game ruins this fantasy. If you enjoy bland graphics, soldiers stuck in the terrain, awful controls and path finding, and an unusable multiplayer than Stronghold 3 Gold is for you. 												I wouldnt recommend this game for the price i would maybe pay 5 bucks for it. The campaigns are super short and dont really let you build up your base design it and upgrade it you are very limited and its over before you can even get the really good troops. Nobody as far as i can tell plays online. Skirmish mode is similarily a disappointment there is only one mode that is a free build mode where you can actually build a civilization and design a base and get the really good troops and buildings. However the map is small and you cannot pit yourself against any ai. So im confused on what the point of it was. I would not recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a fun castle builder that they want to soak some time into. It was a massive dissappointment to me and i wish i could get my 30 dollars back.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												Firefly betrayed my so badly with this game that I will never trust them with any amount of my money ever again.I have been a massive fan of the stronghold games to this point. Stronghold 2 is of my favorite games of all times. This game is terrible. It is worse than anything I have ever tried playing before. Not only are the small number of features in the game broken, but there is a reduced number of features from stronghold 2. They have done nothing to effectively fix any of the problems at all and the game looks and plays just terrible. Units will just walk through walls, not that one should even build walls as there seems to be no advantage to even doing so. Units have been taken out of the game. Most units will just stand there and take damage unless you specifically order them to attack enemies 1v1, in which case they will still only do one or two hits of damage before resuming their meat shield mechanic. The cut scenes are drawn with what looks like crayon or a large #2 pencil by someone who might have taken art in high school. On top of all of this rubbish they have also taken out kingmaker. Kingmaker was the mode that let one skirmish with CPU's all of which had different play styles. This was a ton of fun and pretty much all that one could do after the campagins were done. Now, if one has the nerve to trudge through hours of crap story and broken units, missions, and dialoge; one gets to sit on his/her thumbs and contemplate why the♥♥♥♥♥♥poor decision was made in the first place.I made the mistake of paying 60 dollars for this game. They could have simply re-released the stronghold 2 with an extra couple missions and I would have felt shorted, but content in the long run. The complete lack effort or pride in this game is enough to make one wonder why anyone would have even started on this project. I would now not only recommend not buying this game, but never buying and product that firefly ever produces.  This game is garbage.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												The story is simple, the bad guys have returned in their classic overly zealous kill everything and team up approach as we've seen in other Stronghold games, but this time... well actually this time it's exactly the same as before. You begin with nothing but a small settlement and meaningless objectives and gradually progress across the medieval world growing in strength and defeating progressively strong foes. The story is very linear and there is no tutorial, guess work is what keeps the game a challenge to begin with.I'd really like to say it's a great game having been a fan of the series for years but I honestly wish I hadn't played it. The lack of tutorial or direction for the game frustrated me and despite the odd humorous comment by my adviser, I quickly grew bored. I can't recommend the game but if you do decide to buy it and can get your head around the unexplained and complicated economic system, you could get a good few hours of play from the game. While the previous games appealed to younger audiences, this game is simply too difficult without a tutorial for anyone too young.Pros:•	A lighthearted take on a grisly medieval world.•	Amusing characters.•	Wide range of units and buildings.•	A fairly complex economic system.Cons:•	A linear storyline.•	Lack of tutorial.•	No real advances since Stronghold 2.•	Essentially the same story as the previous 2 games.

content:
Posted: July 22, 2014
												I played Stronghold, and stronghold II crusaders..  I just bought the gold version for a few bucks in a sale. I only play the campaigns, and single player, and i found it very similar to the first game. Many of the early missions were direct copies or at least the exact same feel to them, but they had some interesting twists as well. There are some new additions to the game play that were not around in the first version, and that does add some depth, and helps you grow in power and prestigue while you grow your Feudal villages.  I did not come across many bugs, and have a feeling that many issues of the early game release have been fixed. Over all i found it a fun, yet simple castle building game, that really did remind me a lot of the first Stronghold.  Looking forward to seeing Crusaders II, and seeing if they can expand apon this version of the game.

Posted: July 23, 2014
												Stronghold 3 does not continue the franchise, it is almost like its a completly different game with a similar name... The main quest line is effectively one big tutorial, i have put a fair few hours of gameplay in and still i cant yet build any trebuchets... infact iv not yet developed a settlement and laid siege on an enemy.All missions so far are pre-determined scenario's, where u either have 100 troops to defend a pre-built castle NO BUILDING watsoever, or you build up a settlement again but this time you can use the one level higher unlocked houses, then u comeplete the mission and so forth, just like a huge♥♥♥♥♥long tutorial.Continous games that you set up yourself, dont bother thinking about it, those dont exactly exist, in the end i spent about 5 hours on the map creator, just to try and make a continous game with an enemy, even that was boring and shoddy...My vote is if you are buying this because its the next edition to the stronghold series, DONT Buy It!... pretend this is a random game with a similar name cause thats pretty much wat it is, if i could get a refund i would

content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
												For the sale price I recommend it.  However, it really was a kidney punch to my love for the series.  The bugs are bearable, but shouldn't be there.  I hear people complaining about crashes/freezes, honestly I get neither.  The major concern I have is the incredibly unhelpful fog, where if you zoom out more than 1/4 of the way you start to lose the landscape (brush, grass etc.) and that is irritating.  The other big one is units, and enemies getting caught in trees, buildings, and walls.Pros:Some UI's were increased from stronghold 2.Much easier and better capability for placing buildings.Graphics (but that should be obvious)Sale PriceCons:Irritating and gamebreaking bugs.Bad unit commands and limited ability to place them.Limited campaign that feels like a monkey had designed the goals.NO INTRO VIDEO!Lack of settings (either high or low settings)They put "gold" in the title as if to imply something valuable. (Misleading)Things I was happy to see:A New Stronghold gamesThings I was disappointed to see:The lack of effort put into it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 26, 2015
												This game is full of frustrating bugs that cripple it. They will especially affect the more difficult missions, where you are harassed by enemies, time limits and disasters and have to move quickly. Troops remain stuck on stairs, landscape or between buildings while trying to pass through, forget commands given to them, will take a much longer path instead of an obvious shorter one (which they must be especially guided to find it), will forget to fire when enemy is near and firing on them. Walls will fail to connect and close the perimeter when you build them, leaving you vulnerable just before an enemy attack. Game speed will be ok with a small/medium number of troops and buildings, but will suddenly slow down almost to a freeze when those increase (although this can be caused by my installed memory which is closer to the minimum requirements than the recommended one). Instead of optimizing the game they introduced a (configurable) limit in the number of buildings you can have. Limits aside, some of those bugs do not happen very often, but it becomes especially annoying when they happen. From the graphics point of view the game looks polished but not perfect (just minor problems compared to the rest). You can see that a lot of work has been done on it. It's just that it was released unfinished and has not received all necessary bug patches after release. I wonder if they will ever correct the remaining bugs, since it's been 2 years since release. A lot of people paid full price for it.I bought it in a bundle at a very low price (Stronghold 3 was practically free). So it's about other people's lost money. But there are important things to lose other than money: your time and your nerves. Be aware!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												Well, lets start off on a good note: I do like the graphics. But that's about it. I loved Stronghold 2 and Legends, but this game doesn't really do the series any justice. It appears as if once you finish the campaign, there's not much else you can do besides sieges. You can't do a skirmish like you could do in either of the previous games, and it loses alot of the replay aspect because of this. I've also checked out the multiplayer scene, and there were no games to join, unless I was looking wrong, and I didn't want to start one if nobody appears to be playing multiplayer. That's got to be something wrong with my computer, or something; even a bad game with multiplayer capabilities still has SOME action there, right?

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												While I don't have much experience with the Stronghold games, I did play a little bit of Stronghold HD and Stronghold Crusader HD before playing Stronghold 3 Gold.Overall, I thought that Stronghold was quite well done: Pros:  Engaging and fun gameplay in the single player campaignsNo crashes (at least for me)Pretty decent graphics (in comparison to the older Stronghold games)Helpful Tutorial Cons: Slow loading time when first loading into a map, consecutive loads, even into different maps, are much faster, however.No need to build more stockpiles/granaries after the first one because stockpiles/granaries have infinite storage space. (unlike the previous games)Some missions seem a bit tedious (having spent an hour building an efficient castle layout in a very inconvenient map only to have to spam houses and lumber camps at the end to reach some arbitrarily high population count)"Cut scene" images between campaign missions are black and white. Conclusion: Definitely not worth $30 but if you can get it on sale either by itself or bundled with the Stronghold Complete Pack for 85% off or so, I would definitely recommend it!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 9, 2014
												Stronghold 3 Gold is a game I want to enjoy but simply cannot. The prospect of building up my own castle and its economy in order prepare for war is an exciting proposition yet the unfinished and buggy nature of the game ruins this fantasy. If you enjoy bland graphics, soldiers stuck in the terrain, awful controls and path finding, and an unusable multiplayer than Stronghold 3 Gold is for you. I know many of you will be tempted, as I was, to snatch this game up while on steam sale, however, I recommend against doing so. It is not even worth buying on sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 5, 2014
												Having played all of the other Stronghold games by the lovely firefly studios, my hopes were high.  Dashed upon the rocks they were, throwing up at me from all angles of this delectable piece of garbage.  Ignoring the reviews from the other websites and friends that told me what a piece of trash this was, I played anyway.My disappointment is so great that this is the only game I would remove from my steam games list if it were possible.  Flora's fruit farm was a better war game then this collection of heartbreaking ones and zero's that now take up space on my list.  A game that had such promise, and with a great community and die hard fans to back it, has dug its own grave, jumped in it and then instead of dirt, used its own fecal matter to bury itself alive. No wonder Firefly Studios has abandoned this game, they spent a grand total of 300$ and a drunken frat party weekend putting this♥♥♥♥♥♥together, spew it out for 60$, which the fans bought, and then face♥♥♥♥♥♥♥them by the dozens.  Thank you Firefly for showing your fans how much care and effort you put into your new games.  I will be telling as many people that will listen to never buy another game from your Studio again.  P.S. And no skirmish mode?  How much do you like men Firefly?  Because I just got♥♥♥♥♥raped.

												One of the most exciting RTS games ever made. Economy matters so much, which makes it more interesting to keep up with others. Advancing to different ages (getting better upgrades) is also very creatively made. You have to get enough honor to advance. There are 3 different campaigns. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 26, 2011
												I was very much looking forward to this game, and actually preordered it before completion. That was a mistake.First off, i remember seeing "Co-op Campagin" early on in one of the features the game would have. It did not have this at its release. This leads on to the previous installment Stronghold 2, which was, in my opinion, a catastrophe. I've never played a game with so many bugs, so much that the campaign was unplayable, and I mean really unplayable - The game would simply crash.Looking at the first installment in the series Stronghold. This first one was actually pretty good. There was still an amount of bugs or glitches, but it was playable, and I really liked that one. The memory of the good times I had with the first game, was probably what made me buy this one. I made a mistake...Firefly Studios really screwed me over on this.Stronghold 3 is just another messy, buggy and awful game. The game was clearly not complete when they released it, and it goes to show how good Firefly Studios is. This will be the last game I buy from them, without atleast trying the demo first.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 19, 2015
												This game is constantly on sale for good reason. Economy camp was not so bad but still present with bugs (the most breaking one was as I got whole army stuck on one forest tile because they chased one unkillabe bandit who got stuck there = loosing whole army, luckily I was able to produce enough new troops to deal with the bandit camp before time limit ended)Content feels like mixture of Stronghold 1, 2 and kingdoms (control panel, proximity bonus) with nearly identical grphic of Stronghold 2.Economy aspekt works but military and especially castle building (which always was highlight of the series) is by far the worst of the whole series. I stopped military camp as soon as I was required to build a wall - mechanic completely ruined. You build whole sections with minimal freedom + meele troops can again crush through it.It is often on sale with 1HD + 2 and legends (avoid this one too). I took it on sale (80%) only to get Stronghold 1 and 2 for very reasonable price making Legends and 3 free bonus. It is the only way to buy this game without regrets. Ecenomy camp is not as bad but very short.

Skirmish mode is similarily a disappointment there is only one mode that is a free build mode where you can actually build a civilization and design a base and get the really good troops and buildings. I would not recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a fun castle builder that they want to soak some time into. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 4, 2013
												I don't recommend this game. I am writing this to inform you about this half finished game. There are many elements crucial to an RTS that this game lacks. For instance, death match mode.. which is non-existent. Death match is what gives an RTS replay value and this game does not have it.. just a completely boring free mode where hardly anything happens. There arnt cut scenes in the story mode, only cheesy little picture slideshows with concept art. I find it impossible to make myself play through the boring story. The game play mechanics are very unpolishedl... the worst mechanic being the soldiers.. they move painfully slow. In addition to the poor mechanics, There are many bugs! more than normal! I also personally think there is a bit too much to mico in this game and the lack of an opponent makes this feel like an waste of time. I do think that the graphics are very well done and the character models are great. But aside for a little bit of eye candy initially, the game is mediocre at best. The game has so much potential that it does no fufill. Many people including myself find this game a a disappointment and that feel that it remains in its Beta form. The game play is so lacking. I only got it because it was $3. I would not pay any more of my hard earned money for this lacking game, just take my advice and buy a better game. Don't be tricked by the flashy trailer, the game is very dull. If you're looking for amazing RTS, get starcraft 2 or Age of Empires HD edition. If you like stronghold then buy stronghold 2. This isn't worth your money, to me it was only worth a few bucks. And if you really do want to give this game a try, wait for a sale! DO NOT BUY AT FULL PRICE!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												Sigh.......Before I start please note; I love the SH series.It's kind of like a plane taking off...... It seems like the devs spent so much time loading and loading and loading the plane that when it tried to take off, it couldn't get off the ground and ran into the f'ing control tower.  The animation of the control tower being destoyed was gorgious though...... Pros:-pretty decent graphics, particularly of things being destroyed..... I can't think of anything else.......Cons:-a few bugs, but nothing that really STOPPED me from playing.-Battle AI is HORRID.  .... AI in general is pretty bad.-the basics are just too complicated..... they're suppose to be "basic".OVERALL:Devs..... I dont care about how good the graphics are.  You could go back to the old 2d simple-times; click, click done.  Maybe it's just me, but --  SIMPLER IS BETTER.  Mechanics, mechanics, mechanics.  Screw graphics.4/10A prime example of over-achieving being a bad thing.....

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												This game is a continuation of disappointing entries to the sequel. Whereas the previous ones (though sh2 is excusable as it was the first entry that was 3d) were subjectively worse than the isometric originals, SH3 is all bad as ontop of expanding on the flaws of SH2 and legends and completely ignoring fan input during the making of the game, they pushed out a buggy bearly playable release that to this day has yet to be fixed as everyone at the company knows that it would be like polishing a turd. Gameplay bugs aside the whole experience has been ruined by a frustrating and limit imposing fortifications system, a complete lack of motivation to make anything but machinegun archers and siege equipment, and a lazy dev team that has left the players with only the campaign mode. No skirmishes and a basically non-functional multiplayer mode.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												How long has this game been out? I don't know but long enough... And IT'S STILL NOT FIXED!!!!!!! It's not playable when you try to play multiplayer... lagfest... And not to mention the bugs. Everyone already knows about those. The single player campaign is fun. You will enjoy yourself until you get to the tough missions. Although I suppose you could set it on easy if you are having trouble. Although if I can't beat a mission on medium I just take a break and tackle it at a later time. Maybe I'll try it on easy. And if you play the castle seige maps... (I've only played one so far) you will notice that it's easy to find loopholes in the enemies scripting and AI. I did anyway as I destroyed their battering rams before they knocked my gates down. And then the rest of the army just stood out in the field and waiting for me to send my troops out to kill them off one by one. If they were to update this game and take out the annoyances in multiplayer. It would make the multiplayer a fantastically fun time I think. Fix some of the bugs and add some options such as an "attack move" command - then they could easily make this one of the best stronghold games. I enjoy the graphics.

Posted: October 23, 2011
												The Stronghold licence was always a beacon of light in the RTS world, taking the point of view of real history to build castles and also destroying others' castles !Stronghold 3 is a refreshing return of the Wolf ! Better sound, better graphisms (true fog of war and light variation depending on the moment of the day and the weather), better AI.Two ways of gaming, Economics or Military campaigns will satisfy your every needs.Bonus : the incredible feeling of throwing diseased animals over the opponent's wall to plague their hold !!The map editor  should be a nice addition too.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												Buggy and unpolished ~ and I mean glaringly obvious bugs everywhere.  As well, they stripped out a LOT of quality features that were in Stronghold 2, like the map editor, feasting (which has been replaced by a button), dances, crime & punishment, etc.  It is also now less historically accurate, as spearmen throw their spears (the armed peasants, though, are an improvement).  HP on swordsmen, knights, the lord, etc is still OP.  Weird limits on how many buildings can be placed in free play (you can fix this by editing a configuration file, though).  UI can be confusing.  The only real use I can think of for getting this is so that you can bring in some textures and models into Stronghold 2, since the graphics in this game are somewhat of an improvement.

Posted: June 6, 2014
												this is a good game, in some ways a improvment over the old game. the graphics are fantastic. the game runs smother and the menues are easily navigated along with the great new multiplayer (even if it is 4 players max and you are confined to a building space like sim city). however in my books strong hold 3 will never be as good as stronghold 2 whilst it lacks a custom game setting. yep, they got rid of the best feature of stronghold, the custom game and there is now no way to play against an AI opponant. the closest you will come is playing in multiplayer but it just isent the same. i would not recommend buying this game whilst it is at full price, i think it may just be worth it at £7 of even though i was still left wondering after completing the campaign and logging enough time on the other campaigns, free build (which is the just build what you want with no AI to go against so no reason for military, for those people who like to build a buitiful city really) and multiplayer i was still left wondering weather i should ask for my money back.However if you are a fan of campaign (almost story book based missions were the action dosent really start till the 5th mission) or you like to build beatiful citys with no opposition, then this is a game for you. i definatly belive this game needs an update or even a dlc (yes i would pay, i would even buy the game for £25) for a custom game mode like in strong hold 2. with the graphics and every other feature, this would be a fantastic game that i would not be able to pull myself away from. (even make a mod, someone, please) now im of to play a custom game... on stronghold 2.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 26, 2015
												This game is full of frustrating bugs that cripple it. They will especially affect the more difficult missions, where you are harassed by enemies, time limits and disasters and have to move quickly. Troops remain stuck on stairs, landscape or between buildings while trying to pass through, forget commands given to them, will take a much longer path instead of an obvious shorter one (which they must be especially guided to find it), will forget to fire when enemy is near and firing on them. Walls will fail to connect and close the perimeter when you build them, leaving you vulnerable just before an enemy attack. Game speed will be ok with a small/medium number of troops and buildings, but will suddenly slow down almost to a freeze when those increase (although this can be caused by my installed memory which is closer to the minimum requirements than the recommended one). Instead of optimizing the game they introduced a (configurable) limit in the number of buildings you can have. Limits aside, some of those bugs do not happen very often, but it becomes especially annoying when they happen. From the graphics point of view the game looks polished but not perfect (just minor problems compared to the rest). You can see that a lot of work has been done on it. It's just that it was released unfinished and has not received all necessary bug patches after release. I wonder if they will ever correct the remaining bugs, since it's been 2 years since release. A lot of people paid full price for it.I bought it in a bundle at a very low price (Stronghold 3 was practically free). So it's about other people's lost money. But there are important things to lose other than money: your time and your nerves. Be aware!

Posted: March 5, 2014
												Having played all of the other Stronghold games by the lovely firefly studios, my hopes were high.  Dashed upon the rocks they were, throwing up at me from all angles of this delectable piece of garbage.  Ignoring the reviews from the other websites and friends that told me what a piece of trash this was, I played anyway.My disappointment is so great that this is the only game I would remove from my steam games list if it were possible.  Flora's fruit farm was a better war game then this collection of heartbreaking ones and zero's that now take up space on my list.  A game that had such promise, and with a great community and die hard fans to back it, has dug its own grave, jumped in it and then instead of dirt, used its own fecal matter to bury itself alive. No wonder Firefly Studios has abandoned this game, they spent a grand total of 300$ and a drunken frat party weekend putting this♥♥♥♥♥♥together, spew it out for 60$, which the fans bought, and then face♥♥♥♥♥♥♥them by the dozens.  Thank you Firefly for showing your fans how much care and effort you put into your new games.  I will be telling as many people that will listen to never buy another game from your Studio again.  P.S. And no skirmish mode?  How much do you like men Firefly?  Because I just got♥♥♥♥♥raped.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 16, 2012
												If you are a stronghold series fan I strongly recommend you stay as far away from this title as you possibly can. I could start with the fact that graphics are unpolished, often times are stretched over meshes obscenely, or straight out glitch on a regular basis but that wouldn't do the terrifying experience that is stronghold 3 justice.Perhaps I could mention the incredibly dull economic campaign, which has you essentialy gathering the same resources throughout all the missions with very little in the way of interaction once your infastructure is set up. Or perhaps I might mention the completely dead plot throughout the millitary campaign with nothing to be said for it minus that it is voice narrated inbetween missions?Rather, I think I might mention that the game itself is just filled to the brim with glitches, looking like it was rushed to meet a release date, and then abandoned before it was ever fixed. For examplle, unit pathing is AWFUL. Units will frequently get stuck on completely flat terrain, corners, slight grades such as ramps and stairs, etc. And god forbid you attempt to play online. Just trying to successfully connect and join a game is a game in and of itself.If you truely are a direhard stronghold fan and have the money to waste then you can check it out but consider yourself warned.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 8, 2014
												I'm giving it a thumbs up not because it's a great game, because it's not. People have posted it's not a stronghold game, it is, just not a very good one. If your a die hard stronghold fan, thank you should explore it at least.The game felt like it wanted to be Stronghold two, where you develop your castle into more of a town, but they left out all the decorations. More so, unlike the other Stronghold's, there isn't one stage where you start from scratch and build how you want to build. Don't expect to build an epic army just to meet another epic army in the middle of the battle field and try to outwitt the AI all the while having another army building. Most of the game is simply surving.  Your always on the clock with a limited amount of days before the task is met or you made it through the attacks. What I didn't like was the limited amount of usage of the higher end units like swordsmen and knights, even crossbow men. Most of the game you use peasents as cannon fodder to protect your spear men. Though they added the ability for the spearmen to do a good amount of damange to soliders by throwing their spears, they are still the weak spearmen we all know.They did add a new type of soilder, the Ranger but since you only get to use the Ranger unit twice I never got the chance to explore the unit. If you look back to Crusaders and even stronghold legends, they have less units. No fighting monks and no mercs like the slaves that can burn down buildings or the archers on horse back. In fact there really is no use for the "well".The sieges are way to hard. You litterly have a handful of men and not enough seige weapons. It almost feel's like a puzzle and a touch of stealth when your taking down a castle. The one interesting aspect of the game I did like was the honor system. You buy statues and have varrious special buildings that allow you to throw a party which gives you honor which is needed to use higher end units like knights, swordsmen, macemen, but oddly enough not pikemen. For Multiplayer this is a great effect, it makes it so you just can attack right away like in so many other RTS games. By the time you can build a half way decent army, your going to have to go against the other players castle...But oops, if your lucky enough to find someone online playing, it's buggy once you both get building. I did like the fact that taxes actually were worth rasing and mining for materials paid a lot less which made it a must to have to build your own weapons. Unlike the other strongholds you do build weapons faster.The graphics are better, but not really haven't made leaps and bounds since the orginal. The stronghold series has never been about the graphics. I rather have had the game graphics dumb downed when the game first game out. It's pretty safe to say Firefly is finished with this game despite the few bugs it has. The only good thing that came out of this stronghold was the honor system, which is actually bearly used. Perhaps the only saving grace for stronghold 3 will be if the makers do a crusaders verison of the game.

												The Stronghold licence was always a beacon of light in the RTS world, taking the point of view of real history to build castles and also destroying others' castles !Stronghold 3 is a refreshing return of the Wolf ! Better sound, better graphisms (true fog of war and light variation depending on the moment of the day and the weather), better AI.Two ways of gaming, Economics or Military campaigns will satisfy your every needs.Bonus : the incredible feeling of throwing diseased animals over the opponent's wall to plague their hold !!The map editor  should be a nice addition too.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 22, 2014
												This game is a continuation of disappointing entries to the sequel. Whereas the previous ones (though sh2 is excusable as it was the first entry that was 3d) were subjectively worse than the isometric originals, SH3 is all bad as ontop of expanding on the flaws of SH2 and legends and completely ignoring fan input during the making of the game, they pushed out a buggy bearly playable release that to this day has yet to be fixed as everyone at the company knows that it would be like polishing a turd. Gameplay bugs aside the whole experience has been ruined by a frustrating and limit imposing fortifications system, a complete lack of motivation to make anything but machinegun archers and siege equipment, and a lazy dev team that has left the players with only the campaign mode. No skirmishes and a basically non-functional multiplayer mode.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												BLUF:  Stronghold 3 is not worth purchasing on its own. It has the makings of an interesting game, but it is a weak Stronghold/Stronghold 2 follow-on.Circumstances of purchase: After picking up Stronghold 3 as part of a package deal, I played about six hours. I use a Dell Inspirion running Windows 8.1. I played through a few of the military and the economic levels, then through a couple of the free build maps.   The most significant issue I ran into was the game is slow; not in pacing, but in actual play with lags in selecting buildings, units, and charts.  This lag persisted through all levels of graphics.  Next noticable issue: Regularly military units meshed into trees and buildings. While I could deal with this error with my own troops, the enemy units that got stuck would have free pass to attack any of my nearby units.  I did not test the multiplayer. Fortunately this game was a package deal with the other Stronghold games, so I did not lose my money.  Update: After patches, the game runs faster and more smoothly. That being said, the issue with stuck minions in landscape is still an issue. This did not overly impact my most recent playthrough though.  I am changing my recommendation to Yes.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 21, 2016
												MIXED REVIEW!A wonderful game that takes me back to the days of playing the first Stronghold. There are a few changes to the gameplay, but they all seem to be great so far. It's charming, detailed and enjoyable to play either military or economic campaigns.The one point of contention is the constant crashing and the lack of window mode. When it does crash, the camera spins uncontrollably, the cursor disappears and nothing can be clicked, it's also impossible to open the force quit menu and the only solution is to do a hard reset/power off on the Mac. This will happen every 20mins or so which is a shame. Rumour has it that this issue was non-existent before OSX Yosemite.SAVE OFTEN!I keenly await a patch to fix the frequent crashing. Let's hold out for one!On that basis I would recommend this game. It's a shame to let it detract but there's nothing I can do.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												While I don't have much experience with the Stronghold games, I did play a little bit of Stronghold HD and Stronghold Crusader HD before playing Stronghold 3 Gold.Overall, I thought that Stronghold was quite well done: Pros:  Engaging and fun gameplay in the single player campaignsNo crashes (at least for me)Pretty decent graphics (in comparison to the older Stronghold games)Helpful Tutorial Cons: Slow loading time when first loading into a map, consecutive loads, even into different maps, are much faster, however.No need to build more stockpiles/granaries after the first one because stockpiles/granaries have infinite storage space. (unlike the previous games)Some missions seem a bit tedious (having spent an hour building an efficient castle layout in a very inconvenient map only to have to spam houses and lumber camps at the end to reach some arbitrarily high population count)"Cut scene" images between campaign missions are black and white. Conclusion: Definitely not worth $30 but if you can get it on sale either by itself or bundled with the Stronghold Complete Pack for 85% off or so, I would definitely recommend it!

												While I don't have much experience with the Stronghold games, I did play a little bit of Stronghold HD and Stronghold Crusader HD before playing Stronghold 3 Gold.Overall, I thought that Stronghold was quite well done: Pros:  Engaging and fun gameplay in the single player campaignsNo crashes (at least for me)Pretty decent graphics (in comparison to the older Stronghold games)Helpful Tutorial Cons: Slow loading time when first loading into a map, consecutive loads, even into different maps, are much faster, however.No need to build more stockpiles/granaries after the first one because stockpiles/granaries have infinite storage space. (unlike the previous games)Some missions seem a bit tedious (having spent an hour building an efficient castle layout in a very inconvenient map only to have to spam houses and lumber camps at the end to reach some arbitrarily high population count)"Cut scene" images between campaign missions are black and white. Conclusion: Definitely not worth $30 but if you can get it on sale either by itself or bundled with the Stronghold Complete Pack for 85% off or so, I would definitely recommend it!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 26, 2015
												This game is full of frustrating bugs that cripple it. They will especially affect the more difficult missions, where you are harassed by enemies, time limits and disasters and have to move quickly. Troops remain stuck on stairs, landscape or between buildings while trying to pass through, forget commands given to them, will take a much longer path instead of an obvious shorter one (which they must be especially guided to find it), will forget to fire when enemy is near and firing on them. Walls will fail to connect and close the perimeter when you build them, leaving you vulnerable just before an enemy attack. Game speed will be ok with a small/medium number of troops and buildings, but will suddenly slow down almost to a freeze when those increase (although this can be caused by my installed memory which is closer to the minimum requirements than the recommended one). Instead of optimizing the game they introduced a (configurable) limit in the number of buildings you can have. Limits aside, some of those bugs do not happen very often, but it becomes especially annoying when they happen. From the graphics point of view the game looks polished but not perfect (just minor problems compared to the rest). You can see that a lot of work has been done on it. It's just that it was released unfinished and has not received all necessary bug patches after release. I wonder if they will ever correct the remaining bugs, since it's been 2 years since release. A lot of people paid full price for it.I bought it in a bundle at a very low price (Stronghold 3 was practically free). So it's about other people's lost money. But there are important things to lose other than money: your time and your nerves. Be aware!

But no the game still looks like its a beta that just left the alpha stage. You can play it actually now, but you feel that its still unfinished. Bradbury milked his customers before with strognhold extreme and stuff. But this game is an absoloute outrage. Do not buy any simon bradbury games, do not buy firefly studio games.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 25
												This game and it's developers do not deserve any association with the original Stronghold. A buggy, frustrating mess that feels like it's barely out of alpha, years and several patches after it's original release. I loathe to think what it was like at launch if this is the polished version.The story is forgettable, displayed through cheap rough drawn scenes that spend most time zoomed in on people's eyes. The soundtrack and voice acting is lame and recycled. The gameplay is slow and aggravating, while the castle building is "freeform" it feels more restrictive than the original grid, with towers and gates refusing to go anywhere that isn't a wide open plain.This game was not worth it at release, not worth it on sale, and if it was free it still wouldn't be worth your time.
